Sentencas: Perovskite anodes with in situ exsolved nanocatalysts have been proven to overcome carbon deposition and increase anode catalytic activity as an alternative to conventional Ni/YSZ anodes for direct hydrocarbon solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Robust Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Exsolved Anode Nanocatalysts

Sentencas: This study, for the first time, demonstrates the state-of-the-art exsolution over cathode-supported SOFCs, which achieve the highest cell performance compared to conventional electrolyte-supported SOFCs with perovskite anodes using CH4 as a fuel.
Titulo: Robust Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Exsolved Anode Nanocatalysts

Sentencas: The dendritic channel structure of cathode supports retains a high active surface during high-temperature electrolyte sintering.
Titulo: Robust Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Exsolved Anode Nanocatalysts

Sentencas: Sr2Ti0.8Co0.2FeO6-delta perovskite ceramic is em-ployed as anodes, and Co-Fe alloy nanoparticles are exsolved after reduction, which increases the cell power output by about 40%.
Titulo: Robust Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Exsolved Anode Nanocatalysts

Sentencas: The peak power densities of the cells are 0.82, 0.59, 0.43, and 0.33 W cm-2 at 800 degrees C using hydrogen, methane, methanol, and ethanol, respectively.
Titulo: Robust Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Exsolved Anode Nanocatalysts

Sentencas: The SOFCs with the exsolved nanocatalysts demonstrate stable power generation up to 110 h using methane, methanol, and ethanol fuels.
Titulo: Robust Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Exsolved Anode Nanocatalysts

Sentencas: Interestingly, the perovskite anodes show high methane fuel utilization by the complete oxidation of methane, which is in contrast to the partial oxidation over Ni catalysts.
Titulo: Robust Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Exsolved Anode Nanocatalysts

Sentencas: Robust hydrocarbon SOFCs have been developed by coupling anode catalyst exsolution with dendritically channeled cathode supports.
Titulo: Robust Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cells with Exsolved Anode Nanocatalysts
